alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Crawford; Cuyahoga; Erie; Hancock; Huron; Lorain; Lucas; Marion; Medina; Morrow; Ottawa; Richland; Sandusky; Seneca; Wood; Wyandot (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 24 at 9:55AM EST until December 24 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 10 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph causing blowing and drifting snow. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 10 to 20 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of north central, northeast and northwest Ohio. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 1 PM EST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until noon EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional light snow accumulations are possible through the remainder this morning and gusty winds will continue to cause blowing and drifting snow. Visibilities may occasionally drop to a half mile to a mile at times, impacting travel along I-90, I-75, I-80, I-71, and US-30.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
